attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Thousands of people are paralysed so badly that they cannot walk or worse. Some of these people want to die, if they want to let them. How can a democratic system of government deny a person the right to die peacefully and painlessly? Instead, they fork out hundreds of thousands (or more) of pounds of taxpayers money to look after these people when some of them want to die and the money being spent on them could go into national issues.
